Watford were cruelly denied an impressive 2-1 away win against promotion hopefuls Sunderland on Saturday by a late Dennis Cirkin goal. Tom Cleverley's men have taken just one point from their previous...

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Cirkin rescues point for Sunderland against Watford
arts.sum: Promotion chasers held 2-2 after stunning Louza strike West Brom score late in added time to beat Wednesday Dennis Cirkin made amends for giving away a first-half penalty with a last-gasp equaliser to rescue a 2-2 draw for Sunderland at home to Watford in the Championship. The Black Cats took an early lead thanks to Luke O’Nien but looked set to suffer their first home defeat of the season after Tom Dele-Bashiru’s penalty and a stunning effort from Imran Louza in the first minute of the second half. This roundup will be updated after the 3pm matches Continue reading...
How the action unfolded at the Stadium of Light as only a late equaliser denied Watford a surprise away win.

arts.ttl: Sunderland strike late to hold Watford
arts.sum: Dennis Cirkin made amends for giving away a first-half penalty with a last-gasp equaliser to rescue a 2-2 draw for Sunderland at home to Watford in the Championship.

arts.ttl: Dennis Cirkin’s late leveller salvages draw for Sunderland against Watford
arts.sum: Cirkin had earlier conceded a penalty as the Hornets came from a goal down to lead 2-1.

arts.ttl: On this day: Former Watford player and football 'pioneer' passes away
